content:
Tiger Woods has a rich history at the Masters Tournament. He has won the Masters five times:

1. 1997: His first major victory, which was a record-breaking 12-stroke win.
2. 2001: Part of the "Tiger Slam," where he held all four major championships simultaneously.
3. 2002: Successfully defended his title, becoming the third player to do so.
4. 2005: Won his fourth Masters title, overcoming a two-shot deficit on the final day.
5. 2019: His most recent win, which was a remarkable comeback victory after multiple surgeries and personal struggles.

Tiger Woods has an impressive record at the Masters, with 15 top-10 finishes in 24 appearances. He has also been runner-up twice and has finished in the top 25 in all but three of his appearances.

It's worth noting that Tiger Woods has a strong affinity for the Augusta National Golf Club, where the Masters is held. He has played some of the best golf of his career at the course, and his experience and knowledge of the layout have contributed to his success there.

I hope this information helps, and I'm sure you'll be keeping a close eye on his progress in the tournament!
